meanings.definition: A roundabout way or course taken to avoid something or to visit somewhere along the way.
meanings.sent1: During the road closure, we had to take several detours to reach our destination.
meanings.sent2: The GPS suggested a detour to bypass the traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: The detour we took led us through a beautiful countryside.
meanings.sent4: Life sometimes throws unexpected detours our way, but we find new paths.
meanings.sent5: The detour through the forest was filled with adventure and surprises.

meanings.definition: A deviation from a direct course or the usual procedure.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected detour delayed our arrival at the party.
meanings.sent2: The construction work forced us to make a detour around the blocked road.
meanings.sent3: The detour we had to take made us discover a charming little cafe.
meanings.sent4: His detour from the main road led him to a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The detour through the old town was like stepping back in time.
